column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#T_SP=webanno.custom.Referent|entity|infstat
#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=ALL GOLD CANYON

#Text=It was the green heart of the canyon , where the walls swerved back from the rigid plan and relieved their harshness of line by making a little sheltered nook and filling it to the brim with sweetness and roundness and softness .
#Text=Here all things rested .
#Text=Even the narrow stream ceased its turbulent down-rush long enough to form a quiet pool .
#Text=Knee-deep in the water , with drooping head and half-shut eyes , drowsed a red-coated , many-antlered buck .
#Text=On one side , beginning at the very lip of the pool , was a tiny meadow , a cool , resilient surface of green that extended to the base of the frowning wall .
#Text=Beyond the pool a gentle slope of earth ran up and up to meet the opposing wall .
#Text=Fine grass covered the slope -- grass that was spangled with flowers , with here and there patches of color , orange and purple and golden .
#Text=Below , the canyon was shut in .
#Text=There was no view .
#Text=The walls leaned together abruptly and the canyon ended in a chaos of rocks , moss-covered and hidden by a green screen of vines and creepers and boughs of trees .
#Text=Up the canyon rose far hills and peaks , the big foothills , pine-covered and remote .
#Text=And far beyond , like clouds upon the border of the slay , towered minarets of white , where the Sierra ’s eternal snows flashed austerely the blazes of the sun .
#Text=There was no dust in the canyon .
#Text=The leaves and flowers were clean and virginal .
#Text=The grass was young velvet .
#Text=Over the pool three cottonwoods sent their scurvy fluffs fluttering down the quiet air .

#Text=On the slope the blossoms of the wine-wooded manzanita filled the air with springtime odors , while the leaves , wise with experience , were already beginning their vertical twist against the coming aridity of summer .

#Text=In the open spaces on the slope , beyond the farthest shadow-reach of the manzanita , poised the mariposa lilies , like so many flights of jewelled moths suddenly arrested and on the verge of trembling into flight again .

#Text=Here and there that woods harlequin , the madrone , permitting itself to be caught in the act of changing its pea-green trunk to madder-red , breathed its fragrance into the air from great clusters of waxen bells .
#Text=Creamy white were these bells , shaped like lilies-of-the-valley , with the sweetness of perfume that is of the springtime .
#Text=There was not a sigh of wind .
#Text=The air was drowsy with its weight of perfume .
#Text=It was a sweetness that would have been cloying had the air been heavy and humid .
#Text=But the air was sharp and thin .
#Text=It was as starlight transmuted into atmosphere , shot through and warmed by sunshine , and flower-drenched with sweetness .
#Text=An occasional butterfly drifted in and out through the patches of light and shade .
#Text=And from all about rose the low and sleepy hum of mountain bees -- feasting Sybarites that jostled one another good-naturedly at the board , nor found time for rough discourtesy .
#Text=So quietly did the little stream drip and ripple its way through the canyon that it spoke only in faint and occasional gurgles .
#Text=The voice of the stream was as a drowsy whisper , ever interrupted by dozings and silences , ever lifted again in the awakenings .
#Text=The motion of all things was a drifting in the heart of the canyon .
#Text=Sunshine and butterflies drifted in and out among the trees .
#Text=The hum of the bees and the whisper of the stream were a drifting of sound .
#Text=And the drifting sound and drifting color seemed to weave together in the making of a delicate and intangible fabric which was the spirit of the place .

#Text=It was a spirit of peace that was not of death , but of smooth-pulsing life , of quietude that was not silence , of movement that was not action , of repose that was quick with existence without being violent with struggle and travail .
#Text=The spirit of the place was the spirit of the peace of the living , somnolent with the easement and content of prosperity , and undisturbed by rumors of far wars .
#Text=The red-coated , many-antlered buck acknowledged the lordship of the spirit of the place and dozed knee-deep in the cool , shaded pool .
#Text=There seemed no flies to vex him and he was languid with rest .
#Text=Sometimes his ears moved when the stream awoke and whispered ; but they moved lazily , with , foreknowledge that it was merely the stream grown garrulous at discovery that it had slept .
#Text=But there came a time when the buck ’s ears lifted and tensed with swift eagerness for sound .
#Text=His head was turned down the canyon .
#Text=His sensitive , quivering nostrils scented the air .
#Text=His eyes could not pierce the green screen through which the stream rippled away , but to his ears came the voice of a man .
#Text=It was a steady , monotonous , singsong voice .
#Text=Once the buck heard the harsh clash of metal upon rock .

#Text=At the sound he snorted with a sudden start that jerked him through the air from water to meadow , and his feet sank into the young velvet , while he pricked his ears and again scented the air .
#Text=Then he stole across the tiny meadow , pausing once and again to listen , and faded away out of the canyon like a wraith , soft-footed and without sound .
#Text=The clash of steel-shod soles against the rocks began to be heard , and the man ’s voice grew louder .
#Text=It was raised in a sort of chant and became distinct with nearness , so that the words could be heard :
